text: I'm Matt gross the frugal traveler for
the new york times this summer I'm
embarking on the grand tour of Europe
over 12 weeks I'll seek out ancient
history and contemporary culture I'll
find cool hotels and eat memorable meals
and I'll stretch the US dollar to the
breaking point I came to the town of
Tala in north central Germany for one
reason only not to admire its churches
or fountains norwalk its shopping street
whose name lets you know this was once
East Germany no I came to Tala to leave
this pretty town for the even prettier
wilderness the hearts mountains 860
square miles of hills forests and
canyons located almost right in the
middle of Germany my final destination
the Brocken the highest peak in northern
Germany I would travel the entire 50
miles on foot the least expensive mode
of transportation don't need a bike a
credit card and internet connection or a
passport just strong legs and good shoes
good to walk these woods and use the
broken as a setting in Faust today
hikers come in droves to make the trek
from Tala up the Bois de River to the
next village trice aboard it's an easy
eight miles a nice day trip some people
like these Belgian hikers are much more
ambitious how many kilometers in four
days how many give them it's 25
kilometers in a day so 100 more or less
100 now they're at the end of their
journey I asked what they learn when
it's raining you have to unit quick
close the first stage went by quickly
with just a few stops to fill up on
water that river water may look clean
and fresh but you really can't trust it
one tablet for one liter leave it for 10
minutes and it's good to drink
but after two or three hours when I
finally reached the picture-perfect
mountain village of Tracy Borg I wanted
something stronger than river water it
was the best beer I'd had all morning
still seven or eight miles wasn't enough
to earn me more than a moment's rest so
I pressed on to Alton Brock now at last
I was alone in the wilderness and all
along the side of the road raspberry
bushes as night fell i arrived in Alton
bra another lovely little hill town in
Germany when you need a place to sleep
you look for two words zimmer Phi room
available unfortunately the sign doesn't
always correspond with reality couldn't
happen Abin 909 a few minutes later I
found a free zimmer well not exactly
free it costs 45 euros but I bargained
them down to 35 and hey I had a minibar
tempting but not for this frugal
traveler for most of the next few days I
was walking alone through dark forest
'passed calm reservoirs and sparkling
lakes staying in affordable pensions and
discovering historic pads so I'm walking
north up was once to East Germany West
Germany border and to my left was the
West my right was the East 20 years ago
this whole region was a high-security
area patrolled by troops and dotted with
land mine now it's safe for the likes of
me as for witches and supernatural
creatures I saw only a few but the
natural world was as fascinating as any
fairy tale every couple of yards I'd
stop to inspect the flowers or the
animals of the hearts spending so much
time alone also made everyday encounters
that much more exciting
like when I stumbled on cookies ever
since super cookies specializes in a
yellow split pea soup fortified with
chunks of bacon and stewed with fat
links of sausage it's seriously filling
and just two euros fifty cents a bowl
sometimes I would meet people in the
middle of nowhere this guy was clearing
a field for reasons that it first seemed
mysterious filtrec vagina ah then shine
around Hillshire Oh danger uh cheesin ok
I see and these campers well I ran into

name is Matias yes I my name is Kristin
Christian Matthias and their friends
were going the same way I was through
the oddly named town of Ln Ellen means
misery I think so are you feeling bad
this is the village for you they were
taking their time pausing to instruct me
in a German health craze walking
barefoot in frigid mountain streams me I
wanted to get to the top so I took off
on my own and soon there i was at the
peak 3747 feet above sea level
along with all the other tourists this
is not exactly the place good to ones
trek to a high spot in the wilderness
where witches could gather in private
some of these people hadn't even hiked
up the rocket they taken the train
frankly it was all a little too easy and
now that I'd reached the end of my

admire the view say gutentag two gutta
and choke down a final drop house with a

then it was time to head back the easy
way
these steam engines dick from the
nineteen fifty and they're a wonderfully
nostalgic 90 minute ride into the past
but the past is a strange thing whether
it's the wild Romantic era of Goethe or
the sad militaristic time of East
Germany you can never really stay there
for long at some point you put down your
walking stick and realize you're just a
visitor along for the ride from the New
